data.enText: a piece of body tissue that you contract and relax in order to move a particular part of the body; the tissue that forms the muscles of the body

data.chText: 小腿 / 脖颈 / 大腿肌肉
拉伤 / 撕裂 / 扭伤肌肉
这样的运动可以锻炼腰部的肌肉。
data.enText: This exercise will work the muscles of the lower back.
He didn't move a muscle (= stood completely still) .

data.chText: 他是个聪明的选手，但却缺乏老对手的体力。
data.enText: He's an intelligent player but lacks the muscle of older competitors.
the power and influence to make others do what you want

data.chText: 运用政治 / 产业 / 金融界影响力
显示实力，炫耀力量（尤指作为警告或威胁）
data.enText: to show sb how powerful you are, especially as a warning or threat
to involve yourself in a situation when you have no right to do so, in order to get sth for yourself

data.chText: 显示实力，炫耀力量（尤指作为警告或威胁）
data.enText: to show sb how powerful you are, especially as a warning or threat
to involve yourself in a situation when you have no right to do so, in order to get sth for yourself

trans: 强行介入，强行插手（以谋求私利）

tr: authority or power or force (especially when used in a coercive way)
example: the senators used their muscle to get the party leader to resign

tr: animal tissue consisting predominantly of contractile cells
one of the contractile organs of the body
a bully employed as a thug or bodyguard
example: the drug lord had his muscleman to protect him
He muscled his way into the office

value.def: A muscle is a piece of tissue inside your body which connects two bones and which you use when you make a movement.

example.ex: Keeping your muscles strong and in tone helps you to avoid back problems...
example.tran: 保持肌肉强壮发达有利于预防背部疾病。

example.ex: He is suffering from a strained thigh muscle...
example.tran: 他的大腿肌肉拉伤了，疼得很。

example.ex: There are three types of muscle in the body.

value.def: If you say that someone has muscle, you mean that they have power and influence, which enables them to do difficult things.

example.ex: Eisenhower used his muscle to persuade Congress to change the law...
example.tran: 艾森豪威尔用他的影响力说服国会修改了该项法律。

example.ex: In one town, all the women were urged to remove their money from the banks on an allotted day, to demonstrate women's financial muscle.
example.tran: 在某市，所有的女性都被建议在指定日期从银行取走她们的钱，以展示女性群体的经济实力。

value.def: If a group, organization, or country flexes its muscles, it does something to impress or frighten people, in order to show them that it has power and is considering using it.

example.ex: The Fair Trade Commission has of late been flexing its muscles, cracking down on cases of corruption.
example.tran: 公平交易委员会最近在显示威力，严厉打击腐败事件。

value.def: If you say that someone did not move a muscle, you mean that they stayed absolutely still.

example.ex: He stood without moving a muscle, unable to believe what his eyes saw so plainly.
example.tran: 他站在那里一动不动，不能相信眼前如此清清楚楚看到的一切。
